industries.name: Construction
painPoints: Job costing spread across spreadsheets and accounting software
Project managers juggling 5+ apps for scheduling, comms, and docs
Subcontractor payments tracked manually in Excel
Change orders lost in email threads
Time tracking disconnected from payroll

faqs.question: How much does construction operations automation cost?
faqs.answer: A custom construction operations platform typically costs $15,000-50,000 to build, depending on the number of integrations needed. This replaces $2,000-5,000/month in disconnected SaaS tools and saves 20-30 admin hours per week.

faqs.question: Can I connect Procore to my accounting software?
faqs.answer: Yes. Custom integrations can sync Procore with QuickBooks, Xero, or Sage in real-time. This eliminates double-entry, reduces billing errors, and gives you live job costing instead of month-end surprises.

faqs.question: How long does it take to automate construction operations?
faqs.answer: Most construction automation projects take 6-12 weeks from discovery to deployment. The first integrations (like Procore to QuickBooks sync) can be live within 2-3 weeks.

industries.name: Legal
painPoints: Matter management spread across Clio, email, and spreadsheets
Time tracking entered manually at end of day or week
Client intake forms not connected to billing system
Document versions lost in shared drives
Trust accounting reconciliation done manually

faqs.question: How can AI help law firms with operations?
faqs.answer: AI can automate client intake, extract key terms from contracts, auto-populate time entries from calendar and emails, and generate first drafts of routine documents. Most firms see 30-50% reduction in admin time.

faqs.question: Is legal operations automation secure enough for client data?
faqs.answer: Yes. Custom legal automation platforms are built with SOC 2 compliance, encryption at rest and in transit, and role-based access controls. They're typically more secure than the patchwork of SaaS tools they replace.

faqs.question: Can I connect Clio to my other systems?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Custom integrations can connect Clio to your accounting software, document management system, calendar, and email. This creates a single source of truth for matters and eliminates double-entry.

industries.name: Healthcare
painPoints: Patient scheduling across multiple systems
Insurance verification done manually before appointments
Paper intake forms re-keyed into EHR
Billing delayed by coding errors and missing documentation
Staff scheduling in spreadsheets separate from payroll

faqs.question: Can healthcare operations be automated while staying HIPAA compliant?
faqs.answer: Yes. Custom healthcare automation platforms are built with HIPAA compliance from the ground up, including BAAs with all vendors, encrypted data handling, and audit trails. They're often more compliant than manual processes.

faqs.question: How much can we save by automating patient intake?
faqs.answer: Automated patient intake typically saves 5-10 minutes per patient and reduces data entry errors by 90%. For a practice seeing 50 patients per day, that's 4-8 hours of staff time saved daily.

faqs.question: Can AI help with insurance verification?
faqs.answer: Yes. AI can verify insurance eligibility in real-time during scheduling, flag coverage gaps before appointments, and even predict prior authorization requirements. This reduces claim denials by 30-50%.

industries.name: Real Estate
painPoints: Lead tracking spread across Zillow, Realtor.com, and personal CRM
Transaction coordination managed in spreadsheets
Commission calculations done manually each closing
Marketing campaigns disconnected from lead sources
Showing schedules managed via text and email

faqs.question: How can I consolidate my real estate tech stack?
faqs.answer: A custom real estate operations platform can unify lead management, transaction coordination, and commission tracking into one system. It integrates with your MLS, accounting software, and marketing tools to eliminate double-entry and missed follow-ups.

faqs.question: Can AI help with real estate lead follow-up?
faqs.answer: Yes. AI can automatically respond to new leads, qualify them based on conversation, schedule showings, and hand off hot leads to agents. Most teams see 2-3x improvement in lead response time and conversion rates.

faqs.question: How long does it take to build a custom real estate platform?
faqs.answer: A basic lead management and transaction coordination system takes 4-8 weeks. Full platforms with MLS integration, commission tracking, and AI lead nurturing take 8-12 weeks.

industries.name: Accounting Firms
painPoints: Client documents collected via email, portal, and Dropbox
Workpaper review and sign-off tracked in spreadsheets
Tax return status updates sent manually to clients
Billing based on estimates rather than actual time
Staff utilization calculated monthly in Excel

faqs.question: How can accounting firms automate client document collection?
faqs.answer: Custom client portals can request specific documents, send automated reminders, validate uploads against checklists, and route documents to the right workpapers. This eliminates email back-and-forth and missing document delays.

faqs.question: Can AI help with tax preparation?
faqs.answer: AI can extract data from source documents, populate tax forms, flag anomalies for review, and draft client summary letters. It doesn't replace preparers but makes them 2-3x more productive.

faqs.question: What does accounting operations automation cost?
faqs.answer: A custom accounting operations platform typically costs $20,000-60,000 depending on scope. Firms usually see 6-12 month payback through reduced admin time, faster turnaround, and higher staff utilization.

industries.name: Hospitality
painPoints: Reservations managed across booking.com, OpenTable, and direct calls
Inventory ordering based on gut feel rather than data
Staff scheduling disconnected from forecasted demand
Guest preferences tracked in servers' heads
Revenue reporting compiled manually from multiple systems

faqs.question: How can restaurants automate operations without losing the personal touch?
faqs.answer: Automation handles the back-office work (inventory, scheduling, reporting) so staff can focus on guests. AI can even surface guest preferences automatically so servers deliver personalized service without memorizing everything.

faqs.question: Can AI help with restaurant inventory management?
faqs.answer: Yes. AI can predict demand based on reservations, weather, and historical data, then auto-generate purchase orders. This reduces food waste by 20-30% and prevents stockouts during busy periods.

faqs.question: How long does hospitality operations automation take to implement?
faqs.answer: Core integrations (POS to accounting, scheduling to payroll) can be live in 2-4 weeks. Full operations platforms with inventory management and guest profiles take 6-10 weeks.

industries.name: Manufacturing
painPoints: Production scheduling in Excel disconnected from sales orders
Inventory counts done manually with clipboard and pen
Quality control tracked on paper forms
Machine maintenance based on calendar rather than condition
Shipping documents created manually for each order

faqs.question: How can small manufacturers compete with enterprise ERP systems?
faqs.answer: Custom manufacturing platforms give you the integrations and automation of enterprise ERP without the $500K+ price tag and 18-month implementation. Most small manufacturers can achieve 80% of SAP functionality for 10% of the cost.

faqs.question: Can AI help with production scheduling?
faqs.answer: Yes. AI can optimize production schedules based on order priorities, machine availability, staff skills, and material constraints. This increases throughput 15-25% without adding equipment or staff.

faqs.question: What does manufacturing operations automation cost?
faqs.answer: Custom manufacturing platforms typically cost $25,000-75,000 depending on complexity. The ROI usually comes from reduced inventory carrying costs, fewer production delays, and elimination of paper-based processes.

industries.name: Logistics & Freight
painPoints: Load booking done via email and phone calls
Driver tracking through personal phone calls
Invoicing delayed waiting for PODs
Rate management in spreadsheets
Customer updates provided manually by phone

faqs.question: How can logistics companies automate without replacing their TMS?
faqs.answer: Custom integrations can connect your existing TMS to accounting, customer portals, and driver apps. You get automation without the risk and cost of switching core systems.

faqs.question: Can AI help with load matching and pricing?
faqs.answer: Yes. AI can analyze market rates, driver availability, and historical data to suggest optimal pricing. It can also automatically match loads with the right drivers based on location, certifications, and preferences.

faqs.question: What does logistics automation typically cost?
faqs.answer: Basic integrations (TMS to accounting, automated POD capture) cost $10,000-25,000. Full digital transformation with customer portals and AI-powered dispatch costs $30,000-75,000.

industries.name: Professional Services
painPoints: Project tracking in PM tool disconnected from billing
Resource allocation done in spreadsheets
Client communication scattered across email and Slack
Proposals created from scratch each time
Utilization reports compiled manually each month

faqs.question: How can professional services firms improve utilization?
faqs.answer: Automated resource allocation matches staff skills and availability to project needs, while real-time dashboards show utilization gaps. Most firms see 10-20% improvement in billable utilization within 3 months.

faqs.question: Can AI help with proposal creation?
faqs.answer: Yes. AI can generate first drafts of proposals based on project requirements, past proposals, and pricing rules. This cuts proposal creation time from days to hours while improving consistency.

faqs.question: What does professional services automation cost?
faqs.answer: Custom PSA platforms typically cost $15,000-45,000. The ROI comes from improved utilization (worth $50,000-200,000 annually for most firms), faster billing cycles, and reduced admin overhead.

industries.name: E-Commerce
painPoints: Orders from Amazon, Shopify, and wholesale managed separately
Inventory counts differ across channels
Returns processed manually with spreadsheet tracking
Shipping rates compared manually for each order
Customer service lacks order history visibility

faqs.question: How can I unify my e-commerce channels?
faqs.answer: A custom order management system can pull orders from all channels (Shopify, Amazon, wholesale) into one dashboard, sync inventory in real-time, and route to the optimal fulfillment location. This eliminates overselling and manual reconciliation.

faqs.question: Can AI help with e-commerce customer service?
faqs.answer: Yes. AI can handle 60-80% of common inquiries (order status, returns, product questions) automatically, while flagging complex issues for human agents. Most brands see 40-60% reduction in support tickets.

faqs.question: What does e-commerce operations automation cost?
faqs.answer: Basic channel integration and inventory sync costs $15,000-35,000. Full platforms with AI customer service and automated returns cost $35,000-75,000. ROI typically comes within 6-9 months.

processes.name: Invoice Processing
processes.description: Automate the capture, approval, and payment of vendor invoices
painPoints: Manual data entry from PDFs
Approval bottlenecks
Late payment fees
Lost invoices
processes.solution: AI extracts invoice data, routes for approval based on rules, and schedules payment automatically

faqs.question: Can AI read invoices from different vendors?
faqs.answer: Yes. Modern AI can extract data from any invoice format - PDFs, scanned images, even photos. It learns vendor-specific layouts over time and achieves 95%+ accuracy after initial training.

faqs.question: How does automated approval routing work?
faqs.answer: Invoices are automatically routed based on rules you define: amount thresholds, vendor categories, department codes, etc. Approvers get notifications and can approve via email, Slack, or mobile app.

processes.name: Employee Onboarding
processes.description: Automate new hire setup across all systems and track progress
painPoints: Manual account creation in 10+ systems
Forgotten access requests
Inconsistent training
No visibility into status
processes.solution: Single form triggers automated setup across all systems, assigns training, and tracks completion

faqs.question: What systems can be automated for onboarding?
faqs.answer: Nearly all modern SaaS tools can be automated: Google Workspace, Microsoft 365, Slack, HR systems, payroll, project management, CRM, and custom internal tools. Most new hires can be fully provisioned in minutes instead of days.

faqs.question: Can we customize onboarding by role or department?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Onboarding workflows can branch based on role, department, location, or any other criteria. A sales rep gets CRM access and sales training while an engineer gets GitHub and technical onboarding.

processes.name: Lead Qualification
processes.description: Automatically score, enrich, and route leads to the right rep
painPoints: Reps waste time on unqualified leads
Hot leads go cold waiting for follow-up
Inconsistent qualification criteria
No visibility into lead source ROI
processes.solution: AI scores leads based on fit and intent, enriches with firmographic data, and routes to the optimal rep instantly

faqs.question: How does AI lead scoring work?
faqs.answer: AI analyzes lead attributes (company size, industry, role) and behavior (pages visited, content downloaded, emails opened) to predict likelihood to buy. Scores update in real-time as leads engage.

faqs.question: What data can be enriched automatically?
faqs.answer: Company size, industry, revenue, technology stack, funding status, LinkedIn profiles, social presence, news mentions, and more. Most leads can be fully enriched within seconds of form submission.

processes.name: Expense Reporting
processes.description: Automate expense capture, approval, and reimbursement
painPoints: Lost receipts
Month-end expense dumps
Policy violations discovered after payment
Manual data entry
processes.solution: Mobile receipt capture with AI extraction, real-time policy checks, and automated approval routing

faqs.question: Can expense automation enforce spending policies?
faqs.answer: Yes. AI can flag policy violations in real-time: over-limit meals, non-preferred vendors, missing documentation. Managers can approve exceptions or reject before reimbursement.

faqs.question: How does receipt capture work?
faqs.answer: Employees snap a photo of the receipt, AI extracts vendor, amount, date, and category automatically. Credit card transactions can be matched to receipts for seamless reconciliation.

processes.name: Customer Support Triage
processes.description: Automatically categorize, prioritize, and route support tickets
painPoints: Wrong tickets to wrong teams
VIP customers wait in queue
Simple questions take agent time
No visibility into ticket patterns
processes.solution: AI categorizes tickets, identifies sentiment and urgency, routes to optimal agent, and handles routine questions automatically

faqs.question: Can AI actually resolve tickets without human help?
faqs.answer: Yes, for routine questions. AI can answer FAQs, provide order status, process simple requests (password reset, subscription changes), and escalate only when needed. Most companies see 30-50% auto-resolution.

faqs.question: How does priority routing work?
faqs.answer: AI considers customer tier, sentiment, issue type, and business impact to set priority. VIP customers with urgent issues go to senior agents immediately, while simple questions queue normally.

processes.name: Contract Review
processes.description: Automate contract analysis, risk flagging, and approval routing
painPoints: Legal bottleneck on every contract
Non-standard terms missed
No visibility into contract status
Version control chaos
processes.solution: AI extracts key terms, flags deviations from standard, routes for appropriate approval, and tracks all versions

faqs.question: Can AI really understand contract terms?
faqs.answer: Modern AI can extract and analyze key terms: payment schedules, liability caps, indemnification, termination clauses, and more. It flags deviations from your standards and summarizes risks for human review.

faqs.question: Does this replace our legal team?
faqs.answer: No. AI handles the first pass: extraction, comparison, and flagging. Your legal team reviews AI findings and makes decisions. This lets them focus on judgment calls instead of reading every word.
